website_summaries.verdict: Fast, user-friendly, and affordable, the WD Black 2 Dual Drive is an easy recommendation as a replacement drive for any standard laptop or desktop computer.
pros: The WD Black 2 Dual Drive offers fast SSD-based performance while providing 1.2TB of total storage space
The drive can be used with both laptops and desktops and includes a generous five-year warranty, useful software, and a handy USB-to-SATA connector
cons: There's no support for RAID, and you can't blend the two included drives into one single partition
compared with high-end SSDs, the performance is a little disappointing.
At the time of the review, the drive only works with Windows

customer_reviews.title: Must upgrade for SSD on the cheap.
customer_reviews.text: If you're on the last revision or two of MacBook Pro prior to the retina upgrade, this thing is a must. I wrote a short synopsis on how to get it done over on reddit:  It includes the documentation from WD as well as some tweaks. Would definitely do this on any machine that you want to get applications launched quickly but want to keep the overall price down and still have ample storage. Another good configuration is if you don't need tons of space, put the whole install on the SSD and use the HDD as your Time Machine drive!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Shadwick

customer_reviews.title: Good under really specific circumstances.
customer_reviews.text: If you only have one drive bay and absolutely need need mor than 512GB of storage. Otherwise I'd say get a 512ssd. The SSD portion of the drive is middle of the read speeds for SSDs but still you should boot worlds quicker than a spinning drive. The HDD portion only spins at 5200rpm but over all it is actually faster than most at that speed. The drive itself comes with a section locked. If you are using this for an upgrade like I did you can only really move over to the 120gb partition. Then the WD software will unlock the rest of the drive. Don't expect to move over 200gb to the drive to start out.
customer_reviews.author: Ninjustin

customer_reviews.title: valutable speed and capacity
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Western Digital Black2 Dual Drive about five years ago, and it immediately souped up my PC with the SSD portion of the drive, and provided me with the storage capacity to record lots of tv shows. I am still using it even though the SSD portion seems to be missing. But the speed is not missing so I am still happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice upgrade for most any laptop that can fit it
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice upgrade for most any laptop that can fit it. Its not as fast as a full on SSD. but you get a full 1TB and a 120GB ssd in one. is faster then a Hybrid drive. Installation is quick and easy. The inclusion of a USB to Sata cable to close you drive. Is just a nice touch. its not as cheap as a normal 1TB Drive but its a nich product. I tested it and the speeds are within what the spec sheet listed. Full Win7 64bit boot is 3x faster then the 7200RPM Drive it replaced,
customer_reviews.author: JeepJohn

customer_reviews.title: not worth the pain.
customer_reviews.text: Advertising makes this sound perfect - it is actually a pain to setup. installed in a Dell Latitude E6540 - it would not allow me to install Win 7 to the 120GB partition. I installed this drive in an E6410, started the install then shut that laptop off - re-installed in the E6540 and restarted the installation. after you finish you have to install the software to "unlock" the 1TB drive. got it working, just wouldn't buy again - sticking with Seagate's hybrid SSD drives for laptops that need a lot of storage, and regular SSD drives for laptops that don't.
customer_reviews.author: HighTechHick

customer_reviews.title: was not easy. Once you are done with the soft ware ...
customer_reviews.text: The only dual drive you can get. minus one star because the software you need to use it as two drives doesn't come with the software and the link they provide with the usb drive that you plug in to auto download doesn't work anymore. I had to fish around for the software at WD site.was not easy. Once you are done with the soft ware you dont need it any more though.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2012 Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic drive for Macbook pro 2012, the last model where you can still upgrade things without having to take out a new mortgage. You can get a refurb for $829 + ~$150 for this drive and ~$50 for 8gb ram and you got a rocking Mac Book pro with fusion drive. Install your favorite windows OS in parallels and you are good to go. Love this drive! Also instruction for installation were GREAT! Just beware you will need for fusion drive installation: 1GB USB drive for linux firmware update 8gb >= for yosemite installer + the manual on their website that DETAILS installation instructions! No really, they are ALL there read them!
customer_reviews.author: Supermuncher

customer_reviews.title: LOUD unit!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is LOUD -- it chatters constantly and loudly the entire time it's on. I replaced my original hard drive on my 17" macbook pro. It is difficult to set up -- it took me a few hours to copy everything, prep/clone the drive, and mere minutes to replace it in my macbook pro. That being said, it is not impossible and the directions from WD are good. The performance seems to be good, but the audible chirps, chattering, and tapping is too much and unlike any other hard drive I have ever owned. I have contacted WD, but not received a return correspondence yet. Good luck finding your SSD/HDD!
customer_reviews.author: Buddha

customer_reviews.title: Good for fast boot up speeds, Bad for media files
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Fast OS boot up speeds. Lots of storage for a laptop. Pretty much works. CON: Doesnt work well when playing media &game file, it sometimes makes the audio or video skip. Noise when hearing the HDD spin up. Other: I recommend this to laptop users that need space and want a fast boot time for their OS without paying a lot for an SDD. If your looking to game, play music, or play videos with it then be advise youll see some skipping and video distortion from it. IDK how to fix this problem sadly.
customer_reviews.author: HenrEy

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again. WD customer service terrible.
customer_reviews.text: terrible . did not work with windows 7 even though the info said it would . I tried cloning my hard drive ( less then 78 gb of used space on a seagate 500 GB hard drive ) and the cloning process did not work even multiple attemps at cloning . called western digital and the only thing they would do is tell me to do is try to clone again. since there was no visible problems with the black dual drive i couldn't return to manufacterer. So now I have a dual black hard drive just sitting on my desk, a waste of money. I would recommend not purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: lil birdy

customer_reviews.title: Outdated S/W and documentation from the support site
customer_reviews.text: It is overly complicated set up process and outdated product document left me no choice to return the product. It is in the overly decorated apple product like box but there is no proper documentation or proper software to 'fuse' 128Gb and 1Tb drives. I was able to get 128 Gb portion partition it. When i looked into their program for Mac to fusing the 2 drives in 1. It was using DISKUTIL to create a new partition using Automator. But that failed where it was not programmed to handle any exception or as attached disk You have to replace your booting HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Yong Choi

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously recommend against buying this drive, I bought one for my laptop in 2015 after about a year it died, it would turn on but windows or the bios wouldn't see it anymore, I tried repairing it to no avail. I figured I got a bad drive and figured I'd give it another try and bought another (warranty had run out), Today I sit in front of my computer after 4 days of trying to recover my files off the HDD portion after the drive died again, I stupidly forgot to backup my data (external backup drive was 99% full already) and now I lost about 800 GB worth of pictures, videos, music, documents, and programs.
customer_reviews.author: O. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Love it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Read this! Ok, the drive has a SSD and disk hybrid. At first only the SSD comes up. Download and install the software. Go into windows Harddisk partitioning and create NTFS partition. Done. I was able to set it up without going into the bios. Very Good Boot = 5 seconds Hint: Install windows partition and EX; Photoshop\Office onto SSD and Big installs like games onto the HDD. Love it for the price!

customer_reviews.title: great SSD drive
customer_reviews.text: great SSD drive, mechanical speed is not the fastest but definitely acceptable to retrieve data. The only comment I have to add to the existing amazon reviews is to make sure you update the firmware on this drive once you receive it, my drive emitted some weird beeping sounds upon data access, the sounds did not seem mechanical however I can definitely associate them to the drive spinning up or down, everything acted normal once I loaded the latest firmware from the WD site on it. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: like 12 seconds or so
customer_reviews.text: Overall I had no problems installing it, but I noticed that the rotating portion of this drive stops and goes, stops and goes in some tome periods, like 12 seconds or so. So, it starts when you use it and stops immediately afterwards, basically every time you engage it it takes some time to accelerate, and that makes the rotating portion very sloe. It is probably 5400 RPM if not slower as it is, and this stop and go makes it even more so.
customer_reviews.author: Gothic Recital

customer_reviews.title: Awesome speed, fast Boot and easy install!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Device! This thing really sped up my old laptop and gave me the space to make it really functionable again...it saved me from having to go get a new laptop! The boot speed is WAY faster and the overall speed increase makes this old laptop fun to use again. WD has always made great HDDs and this one is a new record in my books! PS - Install is super easy with the included cables and video online to show you the steps. No need for Geek Squad or anyone else, this is a simple DIY.
customer_reviews.author: Jammer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit for those who only want/need 1 physical drive
customer_reviews.text: For what it is and the price I paid, its not a bad little drive. When you first install it, you put your OS on the SSD and any smaller programs you have, then you install the WD Black2 software which activates the 1TB HDD where you can store your music and movies and higher end games. I have an Alienware Alpha and it really sped up my system while allowing me to just use one drive. I would have liked it a bit better though if they could find a way to do the same thing but not need any special software for the conventional drive.
customer_reviews.author: BeamerMT79

customer_reviews.title: An exc
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drive. If it could only be raided across SSD and HD. needed a drive for courtroom presentation that would boot fast, hold enough DVD storage for fast thousand plus page pdfs, but was patio able and could store huge amounts of video. This is it. have been testing this drive for two months across Windows 7, 8.1 and the WIN10 Tech builds. Not once has it failed. This a great drive... Well actually two drives since it isn't really a hybrid.
customer_reviews.author: McQ

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This harddrive does what it says. My brother told me about it because he was getting one and I bought mine first and he wants one even more now that he saw wha it did. Is working well with late 2008 MacBook Pro, my only dislike is that there isn't a bigger hard drive. I feel like I'll fill the 1tb eventually. If a 2 or 3tb were to be released I will probably pick one up and use this one as a second hard drive
customer_reviews.author: Marc Randolph

customer_reviews.title: This drive is amazing! I installed it into my MacBook Pro and ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is amazing! I installed it into my MacBook Pro and was very confused in the beginning as to how to set it up but after awhile of reading the manual that I downloaded I was able to get it set up. I now have it setup as a Dual Drive so I have a drive that is 120gb SSD for my OS and Software and I have a 1TB drive that stores all of my data. My computer is so much faster and uses less power and doesn't get as hot when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're not a gamer.
customer_reviews.text: Mind you for every day typical use this drive is fantastic, you get both the speed of the SSD and the storage you need, however I had to take it out of my new gaming laptop and put the old one back in because having two drives trying to read over one SATA port is pretty much crap for gaming... the result was large pauses and stutters in my games whenever windows needed to write to a log file of access another running program in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Get drive to extend usefulness of a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this combo drive has extended the life of my laptop. Follow the videos set up instructions to make the process go smoothly. I chose to clone the drive, removing files to less than 110 GB so the cloning operation would work. I keep all essential programs on the SSD and my data files and programs that do not require speed on the regular hard drive disk portion.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: If you've got a notebook with only a single drive ...
customer_reviews.text: If you've got a notebook with only a single drive cavity, it's hard to argue with the benefits of being able to get both an SSD and a large capacity HDD into a single 2.5" case. At full retail cost, it's about the same as purchasing a comparable SSD and 1TB hard drive as two separate items. Get it on sale, and it's a no brainer. If you've never used a computer with an SSD, it's probably time to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Moedius Snarkly

customer_reviews.title: Speed, Space, with one tiny problem.
customer_reviews.text: Very Impressed with this, very high read and right speeds even when both are running, install was like any other hard drive, one thing I do not like is that you cannot configure the 1TB HDD without WD Software and that Disk Manager in Windows sees both as SSDs. Beside that I have one complaint, when reading or writing to the hard drive there is sometimes a little "wine" from the hard drive, not that loud but is noticeable sometimes, but if that is the only draw back for all this space and speed it is far worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product to my Laptop and It is still working great! Always WD products are GREAT! Also speed of this SSD HDD is very high! Other SATA 1 TB HDD also very good! Specially Box is excellent and also the Free Cable set is very helpful to me! Very interesting thing is the KEY with this Hard Disk... That is very useful to partition the SATA HDD and .... Strongly Recommended to Others!
customer_reviews.author: Madhuranga F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: The drive comes with transfer cables and software. The USB that came with it didn't work but was not a big deal i went to their site and downloaded the software. I was going to transfer everything over from my old HD to this but decided to just start fresh. Its really fast. On Windows 7 you have the ability to run a benchmark. The HD rating was 5.9 and went up to 7.8
customer_reviews.author: Thöm Frost

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast & Very Flexible - once you get it set up.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive when I was upgrading my laptops. I find that it is a little touchy (especially on older laptops) to get the installation done correctly, but once it's done....WOW! The WD software divides the single drive into 2 logical drives so that the OS resides completely on the SSD portion and then you can install the pics, movies, vids, etc. on the HDD portion. So you get the benefit of both at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jinxjoe

customer_reviews.title: May be necesary propietary software for boot
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I never had a problem, but I was scared if I lost data
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo H.

customer_reviews.title: It is one of the best solution for laptop which doesn't have 2 sata slots ...
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the best solution for laptop which doesn't have 2 sata slots and you wand ssd and hdd at the same time. Gave 3 stars because out of the box it had problems and needed firmware update
customer_reviews.author: Givi Mdivnishvili

customer_reviews.title: Best Upgrade for a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement drive for My 2010 Macbook Pro, the process to set it up for a Mac was time consuming, but the instructions were very clear and easy to follow. the Drive performance is Awesome! Start up time went from 2.5 minutes down to 45 seconds. WD makes some of the Best Drives out there, and this is one of their best.
customer_reviews.author: michael Mastin

customer_reviews.title: Combo SSHD
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try out a combination SSHD as opposed to a straight SSD. This one fit the bill quite nicely. WD is an excellent name and makes excellent products. This item came with everything you need to install and transfer data. It's a little complicated to return it to a pristine state if you screw up, but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: BuckStar69

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, poor implementation
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great idea for a disk for my laptop, but the software you download to copy your system OS and configuration won't recognize the new disk. I googled it and found many people with the same exact issue. I tried to contact WD and they offered no chat, no email, only a customer log in site and offered a public forum. Thank goodness for Amazon, no fuss, no muss, no hassle ... returned this unit. Thank you Amazon for being such a great vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD just hope you are still running a pc with anything but windows 10
customer_reviews.text: After getting this hard drive I was in amazed at the speed at witch it works. The only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is that there is no mention of the need for a computer running windows xp to 8.1 to unlock the 1TB part of this drive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative for laptops that only support a single drive
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative for laptops that only support a single drive. Huge performance gains with operating system on the SSD while still having 1Tb of storage for music, pictures, videos, etc. Noticeable performance lag on the 1Tb, but that's to be expected. Definitely happy with the purchase and performance. Downside: Drives are shipped "locked" so you can't access the 1Tb storage until it's "unlocked" when running a Windows operating system on the SSD using their unlocking key/application. Very frustrating. Install Windows or clone an image to the 120Gb SSD and then unlock and then copy storage over. Makes it a two step process if you're coming from a 1Tb SATA drive.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Like the DoubleMint of hard drives....
customer_reviews.text: Added it as a second (and third....) drive to my HP 71XX series laptop (which I discovered had room for another HDD bay), and now dual-boot Win7 and WinTen between my OEM and this drive. When I get all the WinTen bugs worked out, I'll swap the drives and try running my online games from the SSD portion, while running my Torrent, video editing and Office programs from the HDD portion of this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Craig

customer_reviews.title: Best choice ever"
customer_reviews.text: Best choice ever for my Stock Hp Envy 15 HDD, it tooks 12 mins for the system to be ready with win 8.1 when restarting, if only shutdown 5 mins, now with the ssd part it only tooks 2 mins from restart and I had disabled windows quick start cause it's not needed any more. I only gave 4 stars cause when your accessing both ssd and hdd it behave strange, but is highly recommended cause you can store 1 tb of digital media!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Padilla

customer_reviews.title: WD Black2 Dual Drive 2.5" 120 GB SSD + 1 TB HDD Kit (WD1001X06XDTL)
customer_reviews.text: Just recently installed this in a Alienware M11x R3 Laptop with only one space for an SSD or HDD. Used the CLoning software which came with the WD Black2. This was a totally smooth operation. Then inserted the USB Key in and downloaded the Driver for the 1TB HDD, installed it and presto . . . 1TB HDD ready for use . . . already formatted at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: GregT

customer_reviews.title: Big Things...Small Package
customer_reviews.text: A perfectly compact blend of SSD and HDD. With this drive you get the speed of a 120GB Solid State Storage Device and the high storage capacity of a 1GB mechanical hard drive. You get all of this is 2.5". This drive can be used in a desktop you want to save space in, or a laptop you wish you had two hard drives in. The best part is; you get both in one small drive for less than the cost of buying two separate drives. Amazing Right!
customer_reviews.author: OrrBITS Services

customer_reviews.title: A win-win situation to upgrade both speed and capacity at once.
customer_reviews.text: A good solution for single bay laptops. Win-win situation to upgrade both speed and capacity at once. However, I just feel the system isn't as stable as having an​ individual full pledged SSD in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lim

customer_reviews.title: Capacity with SSD technology.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most versatile Hybrid drives out there. This one outperformed Hitachi's similar hybrid drive. I gave it 4 stars because I found a 240GB for the same price with faster specs. For capacity and limited physical space, I couldn't find a better solution than the WD Black2.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dalizu

customer_reviews.title: Easily doubled my booting and execution speed
customer_reviews.text: Yeah! bought this to replace my 0.75TB internal drive in my MacBook Pro. I set it up like a Mac fusion drive and it's fast...fast...fast! With about 600 GB stored, booting is almost instantaneous and frequently-used maps load and execute much more rapidly than before. Drive is an apparent 1.2TB single drive when configured like this in hybrid mode.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my HP Envy 15t-3200 (i7-3720QM, ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my HP Envy 15t-3200 (i7-3720QM, 16GB ram, 1080p screen, AMD 7750m GPU) to replace my Seagate 750gb Hybrid Drive. The SSD portion of this thing is fast! It was so fast I thought the the laptop was waking from sleep and not actually shutting down and powering back up. The only issues I have with it is that the spinning HD is much slower that I expected and you can't defragement it as the OS sees both partitions as a SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun J.

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't they think of this long ago?
customer_reviews.text: For those wanting to upgrade their HDD in a laptop, this is surely the best method. Large HDD and the added speed of a 120 Gig SSD combined into a package that replaces your old HDD. The transfer software to move your old data and OS is also included, but you'll need a USB to SATA cable convertor.
customer_reviews.author: Singleviking

customer_reviews.title: Drive trouble in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: The hd is having trouble in less than a month. The ssd still works fine however the 1tb drive stutters with any sequential reads. Trying to stress or bench the drive the tests fail after a few minutes. I thought buying this would save me room in my micro itx build however it just has caused me too much headache. You're better off buying a small ssd for os and a nice 1tb 7200rpm for the same price. 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L.

customer_reviews.title: No Boot Camp for Mac
customer_reviews.text: I did not know that this would not work well with my Macbook Pro when I bought it. After I installed it, it did not run any faster than the current hybrid drive that I have. It was recommended to set this drive up as a fusion drive. Doing this, however, did not allow me to partition the HDD portion so that I could run Boot Camp on my Mac. I'm sure it is a great drive but it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Blazek

customer_reviews.title: and awakens pretty much instantaneously
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace the hard drive in my 13-inch Mid-2012 MacBook Pro. Installed it as a fusion drive rather than showing up as two drives. It has made such a difference as soon as OS X Yosemite was installed and all my info was moved over. The computer is infinitely more responsive, and awakens pretty much instantaneously. Having the SSD/HDD combo is amazing because you get the speed of the SSD and the storage space of a normal HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R.

customer_reviews.title: Revived my older laptop
customer_reviews.text: This drive is phenomenal. SSD is the way to go. My Satellite L755 is easily twice as fast as it was before the upgrade, and there is more than enough room for Windows 7, Office 2010, and any other much used software. Then there is plenty of storage on the conventional drive. I would recommend this drive to anyone looking to upgrade their older laptop, or even a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: I've spent a quite a bit of time trying to make this work. It fails when I try to clone the drive with the wd provided brain damaged utility. It doesn't recognize the wd drive. I can use it as a auxiliary drive fine. But, since I cannot clone my windows 7 from my oem build or install my oem build. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: c crabbs

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Was thinking about getting just a SSD, but a coworker told me about these hybrid drives. My laptop is so much faster now. The install was pretty quick and easy. There is a video to watch that shows you how to do everything you need to do. And the plus is, now I have so much more storage space!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Does just what I thought it would do
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions and I have no complaints. This really speeds up the boot and opening many other programs. I did move the large library files onto a backup hard drive before I started the install. That did take up quite a bit of time, but it was time to sort things out anyway. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic1

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Needs improving tho
customer_reviews.text: Really nifty device. I wish they made more models Like 120GB 250GB 500GB 1TB for the SSD part and up to 4TB in the Hdd part. and the ssd is not that fast, to be a ssd. faster than a HDD tho. and the HDD is only 5400RPM wish it was 7200.
customer_reviews.author: Gigabyte1024

customer_reviews.title: Year long, going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these drives set up in various computers. All my macs (MacBook, MacBook Pro, Mac Mini, etc) use them for about a year as Fusion drives set up with the 'Create Core Storage Volume' setup that WD offered. I wish they still made these so the resale price gouging wasn't so crazy high. I'd like to put these in all my laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Raymond

customer_reviews.title: This drive really brought life to an older (2010) Gateway ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive really brought life to an older (2010) Gateway DX4840. I'd originally bought it for a Samsung UltraTouch i5 but it was too big. I'm going to buy a few more when I get around to building my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn J.

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, and a good option for those that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great drive, and a good option for those that want ssd performance, but either want more storage or are more confident in storing important data on a hdd. Huge performance increase, now my laptop boots in about 7 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: שון

customer_reviews.title: Windows/Mac = good. Linux only if determined.
customer_reviews.text: This drive was tricky to setup, especially as a Linux user, but overall I'm happy with my investment. The performance of the SSD portion is in-line with my expectations. Since the software needed to access the platters is MicroSoft/Apple only, for the Linux user I would avoid this solution for your laptop (at MSRP) and instead pony up the extra cash for a SSD. For a windows user the setup is very easy and would consider it an excellent option for speed and extra capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Rujo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I installed the HD in my laptop e after the first Windows boot it starts do snap a noise indicating something wrong. After some more reboots, Windows crashed e the system stops booting up. I tried to recover Windows with no success. And finally the SSD portion of the disk dissapeared. Unfortunately I had to return the HD.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Diel

customer_reviews.title: One of the few things in my life I completely ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the few things in my life I completely regret buying. SSD really isnt big enough to hold more then a few games and the HDD causes games to stutter when they are saved to it. Avoid 1000%.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Could be easier, but works great!
customer_reviews.text: Not super easy to install on a Mac. Physical installation is simple enough, firmware reformatting and other things seem to take longer than it should. Otherwise an excellent experience Drive seems to be working flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: David White

customer_reviews.title: Returned unit.  Refunded money.
customer_reviews.text: Returned unit. Refunded money. Tried on Win 8 and Win 10 machine. Drive wasn't seen. If it is this much of a monkey trick to get the controller recognized on my computer to access the 1 TB then it isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T. Clem

customer_reviews.title: but was actually quite easy to get going
customer_reviews.text: It took a little setup, but was actually quite easy to get going. I'm pleased with the speed and space this device delivers. My mac has never started up so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Blakely

customer_reviews.title: you can easily hear the sound when you copy data to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Positive: 1. It boots up really fast. 2. It's really innovative to combine SSD with HDD 3. Cheap solution to get both speed and large storage Negative: 1. Heats up really fast. 2. 1 TB drive is not visible by default, you have to install driver first. Thus we cannot really use the backup software from WD to back up your old data first. 3. It is quite noisy, you can easily hear the sound when you copy data to the HDD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Samson

customer_reviews.title: ... faster shut down faster responds quickly software was very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replace my factory 1TB HHD in my Toshiba Laptop definitely made it boot up faster shut down faster responds quickly software was very easy to use, didn't need customer support nice upgrade would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ejay

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Totally messed up. you cannot defrag the 1tb drive because the controller see's it as a SSD when its not. WD does NOT have fix in place nor does it look like they will have one. It was a big waste of money
customer_reviews.author: John_1

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic !
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, only one gripe about it, and that is that the actual disk part, with the moving parts causes a notable hitch/lag when spinning up, due to I presume, low rpm. All in all I wholeheartedly recommend this as an upgrade to a gaming laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Dread Shimmra

customer_reviews.title: Good hybrid hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Good hybrid hard drive. Sets up easy with Windows but has to be reformated with Linux because the programing that comes with the hard drive does not work in the Linux format.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: The Black2 worked perfect for me though its not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: The Black2 worked perfect for me though its not for everyone. Even on the Western Digital's site it states that this hard drive is filling in a niche for people who want an SSD and a traditional HDD but don't have the space for both. Trying to use it in a desktop probably won't work well. For me it installed and worked perfectly for my Lenovo Y50 laptop. The laptop now boots almost instantly and has enough space to store all my files.
customer_reviews.author: Rombie44

customer_reviews.title: the instructions I found were very concise and very easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my late 2012 Mac mini. I had to go to the WD website for instructions as it only came packaged with windows instructions. the instructions I found were very concise and very easy to follow. I had it installed and all my data migrated, using the enclosed usb to Sata cable, in about 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks R.

customer_reviews.title: Windows 7 never started up this fast
customer_reviews.text: This monster is brilliant fast and big. Love it. Installed a clean Window 7 on the SSD and programs on the HDD. No problems so far
customer_reviews.author: A Real Viking

customer_reviews.title: Waooo super fast and useful
customer_reviews.text: Waooo super fast and useful, I have the best of both worlds. Enough storage by the HDD, and fast response from the SSD!!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Luna

customer_reviews.title: Like Magic, it's Two Drives in One!
customer_reviews.text: What a great device. Has worked like it's supposed to for months and I am very happy. Simple to replace your old drive just make sure the OS is on a partition smaller than 128GB or it's presents challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne D

customer_reviews.title: needs work
customer_reviews.text: Great idea\poor execution. Only way to refresh to factory defaults is to use the WD does based tool to write zeros to the entire drive. Took me a while to find that out,including a fruitless call to WD support who said it couldn't be done. Need better training on these cutting edge designs. Only other suggestion would be to add a 7200rpm black drive instead of the cheap 5400 unit in the next iteration.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Snell

customer_reviews.title: Fast and storage all in one.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. I installed it, and slaved the old hard drive and made a clone image to the new one. Worked perfectly. The hard drive is very fast and works well. I would be more of these if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: J.Carter

customer_reviews.title: Two disks in one
customer_reviews.text: if you want the speed of an SSD for the operating system and software 120GB provides enough space. Remaining 1TB for your files and data, makes the Black2 is a good upgrade for a laptop for 128.90 bucks. But beware that, you are in need for a height of 9.5mm bay in your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Naki Ege

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, am on my 2nd one after an RMA because it lost all my data.
customer_reviews.author: JeepGeeks

customer_reviews.title: Mac Book Pro!
customer_reviews.text: So far has been a great product. Using in a Mid-2012 Mac Book Pro Fast boot times and fast file transfer times. May not be as fast as some exclusively SSD drives but is a definite upgrade from any 5200 and 7200 rpm drive. Installation can prove to be a little tricky. A working hard drive is required. The WD Black also has to be placed in the primary slot to configure. Overall, I am happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Summers

customer_reviews.title: Very good hard drive. Startup is much faster.
customer_reviews.text: Very good hard drive. Startup is much faster with Win 8.1 Only minus: it's an older technology. WD Black2 I received was build in Oct, 2013... today is April, 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Yury

customer_reviews.title: will buy again
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, easy to get working with the instructions. it helps manage some of the apps that you install. fast as can be. huge upgrade from my last 2 tb seagate green model

customer_reviews.title: ... once you unlock the HDD part then its all good from there
customer_reviews.text: Its a pain to have it working on a Mac but its doable and once you unlock the HDD part then its all good from there. If you are using on PC then it should be a breeze to set up!
customer_reviews.author: GeeSus

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 yr
customer_reviews.text: Died after 1 year of use. Speed was ok at first, but got slower and slower. I used it in a MacBook Pro. Still trying to contact WD for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Ricky

customer_reviews.title: This drive is fantastic. All the benefits of an SSD (128GB) and ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is fantastic. All the benefits of an SSD (128GB) and then huge HDD storage. I put this into a MacBook Pro. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: DRice

customer_reviews.title: Problematic
customer_reviews.text: I got it and used it for 2 days and its making clicking sounds. Im debating whether or not to get a replacement or just get a 256 gb ssd and a caddy for my old hdd (which ive had for years and still doesnt make any noises) to install into my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fast drive computer boots in less then 20 seconds drive is very fast actually both drives are fast.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Epic Fail in My Opinion
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great at first, but when it goes, it really goes. Too much of a hassle. I liked the idea of it, but failed on me.
customer_reviews.author: DonPachuco

customer_reviews.title: it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal solution when you have a heavy work load for your laptop. The item was delivered on time and well package. it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Williams

customer_reviews.title: Item was as described by seller. It was what ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was as described by seller. It was what I needed to add on my DIY computer and not take up a lot of space. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Niche Market
customer_reviews.text: With a laptop with one hard drive bay and no mSATA, this was ideal. I can now fit all my games and movies on the HDD and still get fast speeds with Windows/CAD/Matlab on the SSD. A bit slower than the 256GB SSD I had before, but definitely worth it for the extra space. And a lot cheaper than a big SSD (for now), once they slashed the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Balogh

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive too thick :-(
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a great drive but it is very thick. Take this into consideration when buying for a laptop, thinner laptops this will not fit

customer_reviews.title: WD Black2 Dual Drive 2.5" 120 GB SSD + 1 TB HD
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to follow instruction to reimage and not lose your data.

customer_reviews.title: ... to install the two different type drives it works good and is fast
customer_reviews.text: once I figured out how to install the two different type drives it works good and is fast.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, freezes periodically for a second or two, did not notice much of a performance boost over standard drive. I would buy a 500GB SSD on sale instead.

customer_reviews.title: No surprises here
customer_reviews.text: Works good, as expected from other reviewer experiences. Not as fast as hoped for though, but definitely faster than a mechanical hard drive alone.

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget if you don't want to spend a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as i installed it the computer changed completely. Now my computer turns on and turns off in just 15 or 20 secs. Great gadget if you don't want to spend a lot of money in a high capacity Solid hard drives, this one gives you the essential space for your SO, and programs. And a whole 1 TB hard drive to store whatever you want. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this purchase. I'm not particularly tech savvy and it was an easy installation. Had some problems with getting the drive to be recognized but that wasn't the products fault, totally my ignorance. After I mirrored my old hard drive everything went very smoothly. I'm very pleased with the speed of the SSD portion of Drive. My laptop boots in seconds now.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C. Givens

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for performance
customer_reviews.text: After I knew how to use it woow it fantastic I have both SSD capability and HDD storage space recommended for best laptop performance

customer_reviews.title: This hard drive is perfect for someone who wants plenty of storage space but ...
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is perfect for someone who wants plenty of storage space but also wants the read/write speed SSD offers. Installed very easily in to my ASUS slim laptop. and the included software to migrate the OS to the SSD was a big benefit.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know I needed to go online to download ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed to go online to download some software application to convert it fully to a 1.2 TB drive

customer_reviews.title: and install from fresh cd it work fine. I suggest they wd need to work their ...
customer_reviews.text: i use this drive to replace my 1tb envy computer; but it is not able to clone my existing hard drive. It clone software provided by wd can see only 128 gb ssd only. But when I use it with asus computer, and install from fresh cd it work fine. I suggest they wd need to work their clone software better.
customer_reviews.author: Baromey He

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Hard Drive, Easy instructions, the included software made the swap so easy. Notice a performance improvement immediately.

customer_reviews.title: and amazing to have all that in the same 2
customer_reviews.text: I have it in my HP and it works flawlessly so far. Boots up really quickly, and amazing to have all that in the same 2.5" footprint inside my HP-Tx2z.

customer_reviews.title: Then it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Had to install the firmware upgrade. Then it worked great.

product_meta.title: WD Black2 Dual Drive 2.5" 120 GB SSD + 1 TB HDD Kit (WD1001X06XDTL) (Old Model)
product_meta.description:
WD BLACK² DUAL DRIVE (120 GB SSD + 1 TB HDD) – THE MUST HAVE SOLUTION FOR YOUR SINGLE-BAY PC.
Introducing the WD Black² dual drive, the world's first 2.5-inch dual drive storage solution. WD Black² is the fusion of a fully accessible solid-state drive for your operating system and a generous capacity hard drive for personal data and large files.

The power of two.
WD has redefined the PC with the next big thing in ultra-fast performance storage. Introducing WD Black², the world's first 2.5-inch dual drive storage solution. The WD Black² dual drive is a completely new approach in a compromised solid-state and hybrid storage market. Finally you can have the speed of an SSD that you want and the capacity of a hard drive that you need in your notebook or all-in-one PC.

Inspired by you.
Your requests to make the notebook and all-in-one PC experience better, faster and more dynamic have been heard. We took the challenge and made it our mission to design a storage solution that delivers the ultimate experience. The WD Black² dual drive solves your storage limitations and adds true high-performance SSD speed to your PC. The WD Black² dual drive is the drive you were waiting for, inspired by and created specifically for enthusiasts like you.

Professional performance.
WD Black² is built by fusing two world-class storage devices together into one dual drive to create the ultimate experience for notebooks and all-in-one PCs. Boot up faster to your operating system with the speed of SSD at your fingertips. WD Black² features innovative 20nm NAND flash with remarkable power efficiency that is poised to redefine what is possible in the storage industry.

FEATURES
Shift_Technology - WD Black² Shift_Technology is race-ready from the starting line with enhanced firmware and improved algorithms for faster performance and data management.

WD Black² Shift_Technology allows you to migrate larger data files to the hard drive and provides your SSD with less system drag, which increases the overall endurance and mileage of the SSD. With less caching involved, there's less time waiting and more time enjoying the things you love to do most.

Shift_Technology Features include:

 * 20nm architecture with quad channel NAND processing for increased speed and performance
 * WD customized controller built for increased efficiency of data management per cell resulting in less drag on your PC
 * Improved drive integrity with 8 GB of space for provisioning to help protect and improve SSD reliability

Reduce SSD wear and tear - SSD performance can degrade when total capacities are reached or after a finite number of writes have been reached, which is a major concern for SSD users. We built our dual drive solution to curb these problems. With our WD Black², you can move your larger data or write-intensive applications onto the 1 TB hard drive, ultimately extending the life of the SSD and maintaining optimal performance across the dual drive. 

For the Creative Pro - Now you can load your OS, photo and video editing programs on the SSD and save all of your capacity-heavy RAW photo and video files to the 1 TB HDD. Keep it all local and readily available on your notebook or all-in-one PC without slowing system performance.

For the Gamer inside you - Turn your dual-purpose notebook or all-in-one PC into the high-performance gaming machine of your dreams. The dual drive's fully accessible SSD allows you to place your OS and favorite game software directly on the SSD which results in faster boot times and smoother game play while still having separate storage capacity available for your work and personal files..

Finesse of perfection - WD Black² combines the shock and vibration resistance of SSD with the proven technology of the HDD for one truly agile and highly reliable dual drive storage solution. Advanced firmware and intelligent algorithms assist in heightened performance, resulting in cooler temperatures with nearly inaudible operation.

You take the control - With WD Black² the decision is yours. Safer than using an SSD as your only primary storage device, now you are enabled to save your data on the 1 TB hard drive, or split data between both. Take full control and manage the location of your personal data. We recommend viewing the installation videos to understand the best option for your upgrade, whether it be clean installation, cloning or data migration.

Software Download Required - WD Black² Dual Drive ships as a full kit with a web key, quick install guide, USB to SATA transfer cable, and warranty information. Software download and internet connection are required for installation. Please watch our how to install videos and choose whether you would like to perform a fresh installation or a cloning installation for your dual drive.

Kit contents: 

 * WD Black² Dual Drive
 * Quick Install Guide
 * SATA to USB Cable (For software download)
 * USB Web Key (For software download)
 * Warranty Guide



System requirements: 

 * WD Supplied software required. Installation of partition software required to enable hard disk drive.
 * Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP
 * Mac operating systems not supported at this time
 * RAID configurations not supported



Ideal for:

Upgrades of notebooks and all-in-one computers by advanced users and system integrators. Users of video and photo editing, graphic design, games and other power computing applications will benefit the most.

Recommended use:

WD Black² dual drives are tested and recommended for use in notebooks, all-in-one PCs, thin client PCs, gaming PCs and other small form factor PC systems.*

*WD dual drives are designed and tested for use in specific applications and environments. This ensures that your dual drive is compatible with and functions properly in your application. Our dual drives are warranted against defects in materials and workmanship in the system for which they were designed. Use in systems other than for what the dual drive was designed could result in compatibility problems that affect proper function, unrelated to material and/or workmanship defects. For best results, be sure to select the appropriate product for your application by consulting our product spec sheets on our website at www.wd.com or by calling our customer support line where we would be happy to help you through the selection process.

Features at a glance

 * Revolutionary dual drive with 120 GB SSD and 1 TB HDD
 * Fully accessible SSD for the operating system, generous capacity hard drive for personal data and large files
 * Lower cost-per-gigabyte advantage over the solid-state competition
 * World's first 2.5-inch dual drive storage solution
 * Easily create a backup of your SSD on the hard drive while on the go or use for massive storage
 * Dual drives extend the life of MLC NAND and maintain optimum SSD performance
 * You control where your data resides with no need for large cloud storage or expensive third party storage plans
feature_bullets: Revolutionary dual drive with 120 GB SSD and 1 TB HDD
World's first 2.5-inch dual drive storage solution
Fully accessible SSD for the operating system, generous capacity hard drive for personal data and large files
Dual drives extend the life of MLC NAND and maintain optimum SSD performance
You control where your data resides with no need for large cloud storage or expensive third party storage plans
Built for laptops, all-in-one PCs, gaming PCs, mobile workstations, small form factor PCs, high-performance laptops
WD Black2 Dual Drive ships as a full kit with a web key, quick install guide, USB to SATA transfer cable, warranty card. Software download and internet connection are required for installation.
